SpNote.note:
A note about notes ----------------
This is a note outlining good practice in note writing for SCUBA-2 MSBs.
PLEASE replace this note with your own note or delete altogether BEFORE submitting the MSB.
Things to include in your notes -------------------------------
1) Overall observing strategy for your science program. A paragraph conveying the general ideas behind your science program is useful for the observer (who may not be an expert in your field) and the TSS. (Make sure to check "show to the Observer").
2) Details of calibration observations. By default, the TSS will add suitable calibration, pointing, and focus observations throughout the night and it typically is not necessary to include these observations in your MSBs.
If you have special calibration requirements make sure to describe to the TSS what is needed. In this case you can also explicitly add a calibration observation to the MSB by adding an "Observation" component and checking the "calibration" box. Similarly for pointing and focus observations. See the examples under "Example optionals".
3) If you need a specific calibration measurement but only want it a few times for your run include it as a separate calibration MSB noting how often you want it to be done and that it should only be done when a science observation for your project is being observed. Calibration observations should be flagged as 'calibration' on their title page. See the examples under "Example optionals".
SpNote.title: Please read
